children.subject: That's a good way to test your own codes. But remember not to use actual codes in homework/tests :D

history.content:
Anyone who wants to test your DP code can use the following DFS method. I found one bug in my DP answer using it.

static int ans = 0;

static int MaxProduct(String nums, int k){
    if (nums.length() <= 1) return Integer.parseInt(nums);
    helper(nums, 0, 0, 0, 1, k);
    return ans;
}

static void helper(String nums, int pos, int mul, int num, int res, int k){
    if(pos == nums.length() || mul >= k){
        if (mul == k){
            res *= Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(num) + nums.substring(pos, nums.length()));
            ans = Math.max(ans,res);
        }
        return;
    }

    for (int i = pos; i < nums.length(); i++) {
        helper(nums, i + 1, mul + 1, Integer.parseInt(nums.substring(i, i + 1)), res * num, k);
        helper(nums, i + 1, mul, num * 10 + Integer.parseInt(nums.substring(i, i + 1)), res, k);
    }
}
history.subject: Simple DFS method to Verify your HW1 Q2

history.content:
Anyone who wants to test your DP code can use the following DFS method. I found one bug in my DP answer using it.

static int ans = 0;

static int MaxProduct(String nums, int k){
    if (nums.length() <= 1) return Integer.parseInt(nums);
    helper(nums, 0, 0, 0, 1, k);
    return ans;
}

static void helper(String nums, int pos, int mul, int num, int res, int k){
    if(pos == nums.length() || mul >= k){
        if (mul == k){
            res *= Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(num) + nums.substring(pos, nums.length()));
            ans = Math.max(ans,res);
        }
        return;
    }

    for (int i = pos; i < nums.length(); i++) {
        helper(nums, i + 1, mul + 1, Integer.parseInt(nums.substring(i, i + 1)), res * num, k);
        helper(nums, i + 1, mul, num * 10 + Integer.parseInt(nums.substring(i, i + 1)), res, k);
    }
}
history.subject: Simple DFS method to Verify your HW1 Q2
